title: Wrong suggestion for E0223 when using type alias

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code:

```rust
type Length = f64;
const MyPI: Length = Length::consts::PI;
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0223]: ambiguous associated type
 --> src/lib.rs:2:22
  |
2 | const MyPI: Length = Length::consts::PI;
  |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: use fully-qualified syntax: `<f64 as Trait>::consts`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0223`.
```

rustc gets confused by the type alias for `f64` via `Length`, leading it to suggest the fully-qualified syntax. If we replace `Length` with `f64` (the primitive type), we get the correct suggestion:

```rust
type Length = f64;
const MyPI: Length = f64::consts::PI;
```

```
error[E0223]: ambiguous associated type
 --> src/lib.rs:2:22
  |
2 | const MyPI: Length = f64::consts::PI;
  |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
help: you are looking for the module in `std`, not the primitive type
  |
2 | const MyPI: Length = std::f64::consts::PI;
  |                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0223`.
```
